dsDescriptionValue.value: Metric and topological measures of the street networks of every US city/town, urbanized area, county, census tract, and Zillow-defined neighborhood. These variables are calculated from OpenStreetMap data using the OSMnx software. Full methodological details in the related publications. See citation info.

keywordValue.value: cities, urban planning, urban design, urban form, transportation, street networks, network analysis, civil engineering

publicationCitation.value: Boeing, G. 2017. “OSMnx: New Methods for Acquiring, Constructing, Analyzing, and Visualizing Complex Street Networks.” Computers, Environment and Urban Systems. 65, 126-139.
Boeing, G. 2018. “A Multi-Scale Analysis of 27,000 Urban Street Networks: Every US City, Town, Urbanized Area, and Zillow Neighborhood.” Environment and Planning B: Urban Analytics and City Science.

fields.value:
Citation info:

Boeing, G. 2018. “A Multi-Scale Analysis of 27,000 Urban Street Networks: Every US City, Town, Urbanized Area, and Zillow Neighborhood.” Environment and Planning B: Urban Analytics and City Science. doi:10.1177/2399808318784595

Boeing, G. 2017. “OSMnx: New Methods for Acquiring, Constructing, Analyzing, and Visualizing Complex Street Networks.” Computers, Environment and Urban Systems. 65, 126-139. doi:10.1016/j.compenvurbsys.2017.05.004

value: U.S. Street Network Shapefiles, Node/Edge Lists, and GraphML Files

files.description: Calculated measures of the street networks (drivable, public) of every incorporated city and town in the United States. Place boundaries are defined by 2017 TIGER/Line shapefiles and the street network data was downloaded from OpenStreetMap using the OSMnx software (see dataset: U.S. Street Network Shapefiles, Node/Edge Lists, and GraphML Files). Towns with no streets within their boundaries do not appear in this dataset.
files.label: usa-cities-street_network-stats.tab

dataFile.description: Calculated measures of the street networks (drivable, public) of every incorporated city and town in the United States. Place boundaries are defined by 2017 TIGER/Line shapefiles and the street network data was downloaded from OpenStreetMap using the OSMnx software (see dataset: U.S. Street Network Shapefiles, Node/Edge Lists, and GraphML Files). Towns with no streets within their boundaries do not appear in this dataset.

files.description: Calculated measures of the street networks (drivable, public) of every county in the United States. County boundaries are defined by 2017 TIGER/Line shapefiles and the street network data was downloaded from OpenStreetMap using the OSMnx software (see dataset: U.S. Street Network Shapefiles, Node/Edge Lists, and GraphML Files).
files.label: usa-counties-street_network-stats.tab

dataFile.description: Calculated measures of the street networks (drivable, public) of every county in the United States. County boundaries are defined by 2017 TIGER/Line shapefiles and the street network data was downloaded from OpenStreetMap using the OSMnx software (see dataset: U.S. Street Network Shapefiles, Node/Edge Lists, and GraphML Files).

files.description: Calculated measures of the street networks (drivable, public) of every Zillow-defined neighborhood in the United States. Neighborhood boundaries are defined by the March 2018 Zillow shapefiles and the street network data was downloaded from OpenStreetMap using the OSMnx software (see dataset: U.S. Street Network Shapefiles, Node/Edge Lists, and GraphML Files).
files.label: usa-neighborhoods-street_network-stats.tab

Neighborhood boundaries are defined by the March 2018 Zillow shapefiles and the street network data was downloaded from OpenStreetMap using the OSMnx software (see dataset: U.S. Street Network Shapefiles, Node/Edge Lists, and GraphML Files).

files.description: Calculated measures of the street networks (drivable, public) of every census tract in the United States. Tract boundaries are defined by 2017 TIGER/Line shapefiles and the street network data was downloaded from OpenStreetMap using the OSMnx software (see dataset: U.S. Street Network Shapefiles, Node/Edge Lists, and GraphML Files).

dataFile.description: Calculated measures of the street networks (drivable, public) of every census tract in the United States. Urbanized area boundaries are defined by 2017 TIGER/Line shapefiles and the street network data was downloaded from OpenStreetMap using the OSMnx software (see dataset: U.S. Street Network Shapefiles, Node/Edge Lists, and GraphML Files).
